pullRequest.body:
We prove the following result : if `f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ` is such that `(‚àë k ‚àà Icc 1 n, f k) / n` tends to some complex number `l` when `n ‚Üí ‚àû` and that the L-series `LSeries f` converges for all `s : ‚Ñù` such that `1 < s`, then  `(s - 1) * LSeries f s` tends to `l` when `s ‚Üí 1` with `1 < s`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #20661

### PR summary [7354454d63](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20660/commits/7354454d6334c7bf78153d516f0a60e395889496)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LSeries_tendsto_sub_mul_nhds_one_of_tendsto_sum_div`
`+ LSeries_tendsto_sub_mul_nhds_one_of_tendsto_sum_div_and_nonneg`
`+ integrableOn_Ioi_norm_cpow_iff`
`+ integrableOn_Ioi_norm_cpow_of_lt`
`+ isBigO_atTop_natCast_rpow_of_tendsto_div_rpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20661~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> Hi Xavier,
> 
> I won't have time to actually try compiling this and experimenting with it for a day or two, so here are some stylistic comments based only on reading the code on github.

Thanks for the first comments. Don't worry, there is no need to hurry.

@loefflerd, thanks for the review. I'll start working on incorporating your suggestions soon. Still, since I am a good citizen, I made #21453 and #21454. I think #21453 is probably uncontroversial, but #21454 might be more difficult to accept so I am planning to make a Zulip post about it.

Hi Xavier, 

I won't have time to actually try compiling this and experimenting with it for a day or two, so here are some stylistic comments based only on reading the code on github.
Here are some more detailed ocmments on the first half (up to line 250 of the main file)

Here are some further comments. All my remarks are quite "localised", I'm completely happy with the general strategy. I've just tried to suggest a few places where more automated tactics can be used; this is slower, but makes things less likely to break in future.

(It's a pity the automated tactics can't do more; it would be nice if `linarith` could see through the definition of `Set.Icc` etc. But I'm no expert on tactic hacking so I don't know how easy or hard that is.)
merge artifact?
I think using the "mapsto" arrow is preferred style
Using `variable` with Prop-valued hypotheses tends to be a bit clumsy; you have to `include` them every time, so it's probably simpler just to reproduce the hypothesis in each lemma
can `linarith` handle this?
(`linarith [mul_lt_mul_of_pos_right sle2 (show 0 < Œµ / 6 by positivity)]` seems to work)
I would personally find it clearer if the proofs of the calc steps were interleaved between the calc lines rather than being stored up and done at the end.
Same comment here. I suggest **not** indenting the `calc` steps, so they stand out visually from the proofs indented in between.
can we use `continuity` or `fun_prop` here?
(apparently not)
The body of the `suffices` is shorter than the remaining proof, so maybe use `have`?
Is it possible that these fiddly inequality manipulations could be avoided by using a "softer" approach working with filters, rather than rewriting everything in terms of epsilons?
Yeah, there is a much simpler proof using `limsup` but I found it painful to work with it in the past. Still, I can give it another try.

I was thinking more of whether something like `Eventually.and` or `filter_upwards` etc could help you, but that was a rather naive comment before I had a chance to really read the proof, and probably it doesn't work. Sorry for the noise!
Anyway, I decided I would not let the `limsup` API bully me so I wrote a new proof using `limsup`. Sorry about the extra work :)

slight golfs:
```suggestion
  refine (isBigO_of_div_tendsto_nhds ?_ ‚Äña‚Äñ ?_).of_norm_left
  ¬∑ filter_upwards [eventually_ne_atTop 0] with _ h
    simp [rpow_eq_zero_iff_of_nonneg, h]
  ¬∑ refine hlim.norm.congr fun n ‚Ü¶ ?_
    simp [abs_of_nonneg, show 0 ‚â§ (n : ‚Ñù) ^ r by positivity]
```
Incidentally, we have a file `SpecialFunctions.Pow.Asymptotics`; can you move this lemma, and the couple of other asymptotic results currently in `SpecialFunctions.Pow.Real`, to there?

```suggestion
  ¬∑ filter_upwards [eventually_ge_atTop T, eventually_gt_atTop 0] with t ht ht'
    simpa [_root_.abs_of_nonneg, Real.rpow_nonneg, ht'.le, Real.rpow_sub ht', mul_assoc, ht'.ne', 
      mul_div_cancel‚ÇÄ] using mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right (hS‚ÇÇ t ht) (norm_nonneg <| t ^ (-s - 1))
```

It is annoying to have to write `_root_.abs_of_nonneg`. Someone should really add the `protected` flag to `Complex.abs_of_nonneg`, to stop it shadowing the root namespace declaration.

```suggestion
private theorem lemma‚ÇÇ {s T Œµ : ‚Ñù} {S : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ} (hs : 1 < s)
```
(not needed)
Good point!

```suggestion
    simp [div_mul_div_cancel‚ÇÄ (show (‚åät‚åã‚Çä : ‚ÑÇ) ‚â† 0 by simpa)]
  filter_upwards [eventually_gt_atTop 0, Metric.tendsto_nhds.mp h_lim' Œµ hŒµ] with t ht‚ÇÅ ht‚ÇÇ
```
Again, if you feel like a good citizen you could make the first three arguments to `div_sub'` implicit.

```suggestion
  ¬∑ rw [integral_Ioi_rpow_of_lt (by rwa [neg_lt_neg_iff]) zero_lt_one, Real.one_rpow]
    field_simp [show -s + 1 ‚â† 0 by linarith, hŒµ.ne']
    ring
```
(slower, but hopefully more robust)

```suggestion
    simpa using locallyIntegrableOn_mul_sum_Icc f zero_le_one (locallyIntegrableOn_const 1)
```

```suggestion
  ¬∑ rw [‚Üê Set.Ioc_union_Ioi_eq_Ioi hT‚ÇÅ, setIntegral_union Set.Ioc_disjoint_Ioi_same
```

```suggestion
  have slt2 : s < 2 := by simp [abs_lt] at hs‚ÇÇ; linarith
```

```suggestion
    Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * LSeries (f ¬∑) s) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù l) := by
  refine LSeries_tendsto_sub_mul_nhds_one_of_tendsto_sum_div 
    (hf.ofReal.congr fun _ ‚Ü¶ ?_) fun s hs ‚Ü¶ ?_
  ¬∑ simp
  ¬∑ refine LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO_and_nonneg ?_ hf' zero_le_one hs
    exact isBigO_atTop_natCast_rpow_of_tendsto_div_rpow (by simpa)
```

```suggestion
  specialize hŒ¥‚ÇÅ hs‚ÇÅ (by simp at hs‚ÇÇ; tauto)
  specialize hŒ¥‚ÇÇ hs‚ÇÅ (by simp at hs‚ÇÇ; tauto)
```
This proof is very long and needs some comments to the strategy a bit clearer. (I've heard it suggested that you should have at least one comment every 10 lines.)

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): results involving partial sums of coefficients (part 2)

source.title: feat(NumberTheory/NumberField): proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula
